intro: Trophaeum quinatum, commonly known as the golden star fern, is a rare and unique plant belonging to the family Polypodiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, star-shaped fronds that are covered in fine, golden hairs, giving it a striking appearance. The plant is native to specific regions of Southeast Asia, where it thrives in humid, shaded environments. Its reproductive structures are small and clustered, contributing to its limited distribution. Due to its rarity and specific habitat requirements, Trophaeum quinatum is considered an endangered species in its natural range.
